message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $170.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand that $120 is a good price for you, Bob, but I'm not willing to go that low. I'm willing to meet you in the middle and offer it to you for $145. It's a fair price considering the product's value and quality.
I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to go down to $130?

I understand that you're still looking for a better deal, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make sure I'm not losing too much. I'll offer it to you for $140. It's the lowest I can go without losing money on the deal.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $125?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make sure I'm not losing too much. I'll offer it to you for $135. It's the lowest I can go without losing money on the deal.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $130?

I'm not willing to go any lower, Bob. I've already made significant concessions, and I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price for the product. I'll offer it to you for $135 again, and that's my final offer.
I understand that you're not willing to go any lower, but I'm still interested in the product. I'll offer $130 one more time, and that's my final offer. If not, I'll have to consider other options.
